body:
Hey guys,

People have been whining about how I cant get high fps, but down below is proof that I can, well above 100 frames. Enjoy!

title: My average fps...

replies.body: My god is your computer on steroids or some shit!?!??
replies.body_tagged: My god is your computer on steroids or some shit!?!??

replies.body:
Somewhat, I'll upload specs..

NZXT S340 Mid-Tower Case
Corsair Builder Series CX 600 Watt
WD Blue 1TB SATA 6Gb/s 7200rpm Internal Hard Drive
Crucial MX100 256GB SATA 2.5-Inch Internal Solid State Drive
Corsair Vengeance Blue 8 GB (2X4 GB) PC3-12800 1600mHz DDR3
MSI ATX DDR3 2400 LGA 1150 Motherboards H97 GUARD-PRO
EVGA GeForce GTX 970 Super Clocked ACX 2.0 4GB GDDR5 Graphics Card
Intel Core i5-4460 LGA 1150 CPU

replies.body:
I've got 1000+ fps With shaders with my 980 C... Fucking overkill but it works (Multiplayer).

On the other hand... Not that impressive for a 970 in a basically open world to get 1000 fps... My friend has a 760 and it still reaches above 1000 fps in a regular world (But he has a better CPU, AMD FX-8350) So...

Here's mine:

I might be kind of a hypocrite for saying this, but you can still play a lot of games on 3-4 year old hardware.. I've tested my old Build and at Max settings it gave above 600 fps in minecraft, even with Hyperthreading disabled on the i7

replies.body: If you have a computer that's not only for minecraft.. You will need a good GPU and CPU along with other minor parts to play triple A titles at high settings. I got mine, there is no difference in 120-1000 fps, but there is a difference when you want to play with shaders/other games.
replies.body_tagged: If you have a computer that's not only for minecraft.. You will need a good GPU and CPU along with other minor parts to play triple A titles at high settings. I got mine, there is no difference in 120-1000 fps, but there is a difference when you want to play with shaders/other games.

replies.body:
Waste of money going for a 3-way 970. $350 x 3 = %1005, While a 2-way 980 beats the 3 way of 970s and only costing $900... As well as using less power than the 970's

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dwiuD1WtnNs
The 3 970's mostly gave out better fps, but so much stuttering,
Much more heat output,
MUCH greater power consumption,
And in most cases did nothing at all...


While the 2 980's maintained the same fps,
They had less heat output,
Much less power intake,
and for the money has no stuttering in games like Crysis 3, and FC 4...

May I know other parts?
replies.body_tagged:
